column1: Bataysk (Russian: Бата́йск) is a city in Rostov Oblast
column3: located 15 kilometers (9.3 mi) southwest of Rostov-on-Don. Population: 111

column2: and was granted town status in 1938. The reconstructed Church of the Ascension was built between 1990 and 2006.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as Bataysk Urban Okrug—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: this administrative unit also has urban okrug status.

column1: Bataysk has gained international attention since unveiling a "monument that shows a man's hand gripping a nubile female breast"
column2: which officials say "will bring family happiness to men who touch it".
